definition: far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)

sentences.english: We were going to travel together to as far as Paris.
sentences.chinese: 我们曾打算一起远游到巴黎。

sentences.english: The Master said, "When your parents are alive, do not travel far."
sentences.chinese: 子岳，“父母在，不远游，游必有方。”

sentences.english: Parents, not to travel, swim will be well.
sentences.chinese: 父母在，不远游，游必有方。

sentences.english: He had travelled far, had seen much of the world.
sentences.chinese: 他曾经远游，见过许多世面。

sentences.english: Xiaozhang is planning to spend the long national holiday travelling abroad.
sentences.chinese: 小张准备利用今年国庆长假出国远游。

definition: to wander (typically of an errant priest)
to drift (in the tide)/to rove/to lead a wandering existence/drifter/wanderer
to return home/fig. to retire from public life
person living or traveling far from home
to roam far and wide (idiom)/to travel the world
to seek knowledge/to study/to attend college
to regard the four corners of the world all as home (idiom)/to feel at home anywhere/to roam about unconstrained/to consider the entire country, or world, to be one's own
to live in a foreign place/to live somewhere as a guest
